0: Prepare and process import and export documentation according to customs regulations, laws, or procedures.
Clear goods through customs and to their destinations for clients.
Pay, or arrange for payment of, taxes and duties on shipments.
Calculate duty and tariff payments owed on shipments.
Request or compile necessary import documentation, such as customs invoices, certificates of origin, and cargo-control documents.
Classify goods according to tariff coding system.
Stay abreast of changes in import or export laws or regulations by reading current literature, attending meetings or conferences, or conferring with colleagues.
Sign documents on behalf of clients, using powers of attorney.
Advise customers on import and export restrictions, tariff systems, insurance requirements, quotas, or other customs-related matters.
Post bonds for the products being imported or assist clients in obtaining bonds.
Quote duty and tax rates on goods to be imported, based on federal tariffs and excise taxes.
Arrange for transportation, warehousing, or product distribution of imported or exported products.
Monitor or trace the location of goods.
Confer with officials in various agencies to facilitate clearance of goods through customs and quarantine.
Inform importers and exporters of steps to reduce duties and taxes.
Obtain line releases for frequent shippers of low-risk commodities, high-volume entries, or multiple-container loads.
Provide advice on transportation options, types of carriers, or shipping routes.
Contract with freight forwarders for destination services.
Apply for tariff concessions or for duty drawbacks and other refunds.
Insure cargo against loss, damage, or pilferage.
Prepare papers for shippers to appeal duty charges.
1: Analyze training needs to develop new training programs or modify and improve existing programs.
Evaluate instructor performance and the effectiveness of training programs, providing recommendations for improvement.

Plan, develop, and provide training and staff development programs, using knowledge of the effectiveness of methods such as classroom training, demonstrations, on-the-job training, meetings, conferences, and workshops.
Confer with management and conduct surveys to identify training needs based on projected production processes, changes, and other factors.
Conduct orientation sessions and arrange on-the-job training for new hires.
Train instructors and supervisors in techniques and skills for training and dealing with employees.
Develop and organize training manuals, multimedia visual aids, and other educational materials.
Prepare training budget for department or organization.
Develop testing and evaluation procedures.
Conduct or arrange for ongoing technical training and personal development classes for staff members.
Review and evaluate training and apprenticeship programs for compliance with government standards.
2: Monitor and record food temperatures to ensure food safety.
Cook foodstuffs according to menus, special dietary or nutritional restrictions, or numbers of portions to be served.
Wash pots, pans, dishes, utensils, or other cooking equipment.
Apportion and serve food to facility residents, employees, or patrons.
Clean and inspect galley equipment, kitchen appliances, and work areas to ensure cleanliness and functional operation.
Clean, cut, and cook meat, fish, or poultry.
Direct activities of one or more workers who assist in preparing and serving meals.
Take inventory of supplies and equipment.
Requisition food supplies, kitchen equipment, and appliances, based on estimates of future needs.
Bake breads, rolls, or other pastries.

0: Verify imported goods against customs declarations to ensure accuracy and compliance with regulations.
Negotiate with importers and suppliers to resolve export duties, taxes, and other trade-related issues.
Coordinate and manage the clearance process for shipments through U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP).
Prepare and submit necessary documents, such as commercial invoices and bill of lading, for customs clearance.
Analyze and interpret regulations, laws, and trade agreements to ensure compliance with international trade requirements.
Arrange for expedited processing or expedited screening of high-priority shipments when required by clients.
Investigate discrepancies between shipment documentation and customs entries.
Maintain accurate records of all imports, exports, and trade transactions.
Communicate effectively with U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) officers to resolve any discrepancies or issues during the clearance process.
Develop and implement strategies to reduce client costs on import duties and taxes.
Monitor and report changes in import regulations, tariffs, and tax laws to clients.
Coordinate with freight forwarders, airlines, and other transportation providers to ensure smooth delivery of shipments.
Prepare for and respond to audits and inspections conducted by U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) or other regulatory agencies.
Maintain knowledge of and stay up-to-date on relevant laws, regulations, and trade agreements affecting international trade.
Arrange for the release of detained or seized cargo due to customs disputes or errors.
Develop and implement trade compliance programs to minimize risks and ensure regulatory compliance.
Prepare customs brokers' licenses and certifications as required by regulatory agencies.
Monitor and respond to changes in global events, natural disasters, and other factors that may impact international trade.
Coordinate with clients to understand their import needs and provide recommendations for cost-effective solutions.
Maintain client relationships through effective communication, proactive issue resolution, and exceptional customer service.
Prepare financial reports and statements on imports, exports, and trade transactions for internal or external audit purposes.
1: Develops training programs to meet organizational goals and objectives, aligning with industry best practices and stakeholder needs.
Analyzes training needs assessment data to inform program design, optimization, and evaluation, ensuring data-driven decision-making.
Creates engaging content, including presentations, videos, and interactive modules, that cater to diverse learning styles and abilities.
Establishes partnerships with external providers to access specialized expertise, tools, and resources, expanding the organization's capabilities.
Designs and delivers onboarding programs for new hires, ensuring a seamless transition into the company culture and processes.
Conducts needs assessments and gap analyses to identify training gaps and areas for improvement, developing targeted intervention strategies.
Manages budgets and resources, allocating funds effectively to support training initiatives and measuring ROI against organizational objectives.
Collaborates with subject matter experts to develop content, ensuring accuracy and relevance in the training materials provided.
Evaluates the effectiveness of training programs, using metrics such as participation rates, learner engagement, and job performance data.
Identifies emerging trends and technologies that can be incorporated into future training initiatives, promoting innovation and stay-ahead solutions.
Creates a positive and inclusive learning environment by fostering an organizational culture that values continuous learning, inclusivity, and growth.
2:
# Preparing and cooking meals in accordance with nutritional standards and institutional policies to ensure the health and well-being of clients (Goal: Serving nutritious food to meet clients' dietary needs).
# Maintaining a clean and organized kitchen environment by adhering to HACCP guidelines and sanitizing equipment, utensils, and workstations.
# Receiving and processing orders from patrons in a timely manner while ensuring accuracy and quality of food preparation (Goal: Delivering excellent customer service through efficient order fulfillment).
# Supervising and training junior staff members on proper food handling techniques, kitchen safety protocols, and menu preparation methods.
# Planning and ordering ingredients and supplies to minimize waste, optimize inventory management, and maintain cost control.
# Conducting regular quality checks on prepared meals to ensure they meet institutional standards and culinary excellence (Goal: Maintaining high-quality food presentation and taste).
# Collaborating with nutritionists and dietitians to develop healthy menu options that cater to specific dietary needs and restrictions.
# Managing inventory levels, monitoring expirations dates, and optimizing stock rotation to minimize waste and reduce costs.
# Participating in food safety inspections and maintaining a spotless kitchen environment by following proper cleaning schedules and protocols (Goal: Ensuring compliance with health regulations).
# Preparing special dietary meals, such as gluten-free or vegan options, according to specific client requests and institutional guidelines.
# Adhering to all relevant health and safety codes, including those related to food handling, sanitation, and equipment maintenance (Goal: Protecting staff, clients, and the public from harm).
# Maintaining accurate records of meal production, inventory management, and food waste disposal to inform future menu planning and cost control strategies.
